notes: In the framework of the AMICAF project (Analysis and Mapping of Impacts under Climate Change for Adaptation and Food Security), MOSAICC was implemented and used for assessing climate change impacts at local level, starting from relevant meteorological variables such as maximum and minimum temperature, and precipitation. These results have been incorporated in a public portal for data visualization and analysis, in order to support decision making for facing droughts-related risks

resources.name: MOSAICC Peru outputs of climate downscaling on "National Droughts Observatory" website
resources.description: Country experience of the application of the MOSAICC climate downscaling component in Peru. The explaination of the process and the final results are presented by the National Droughts Observatory.

This publication is part of the project “Assessment of the impacts of climate change and vulnerability mapping food insecurity under climate change to strengthen household food security approach to adapting livelihoods - AMICAF” funded by Japanese government and framed into Charter of Institutional Agreement with the National Service of Meteorology and Hydrology of Peru (SENAMHI).
resources.name: Statistical downscaling of cliamte scenarios over Peru

resources.description: Political recommendations for confronting climate change and vulnerability of food security
resources.name: Policy recommendations for confronting climate change and vulnerability of food security

name: country-experience-on-mosaicc-latin-americaand-thecaribbean

groups.description: Climate change threatens our ability to ensure global food security, eradicate poverty and achieve sustainable development. Greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions from human activity and livestock are a significant driver of climate change, trapping heat in the earth's atmosphere and triggering global warming.
groups.name: climate-change-adaptation
groups.title: Climate change adaptation and resilience
